revdescription.para: Initial conversion of document to DocBook format

sect1.title: 1 – Introduction
sect1.para: -The fact that almost health workers are familiar with office softwares, such as: Microsoft Office, Open Office, etc. to make reports is demanding. For the health workers, the statistical reports are very important to submit to the managers with Excel format file which is easy to modify, customize and transmit.

-Users, esp. the health workers, can use DHIS 2 easily with the new Excel reporting tool developed by HISP Vietnam team, based on HISP India team’s ideas and technologies HISP India and Vietnam team and embedded into DHIS 2 for local users in Vietnam. This reporting tool with Excel output files uses less memory and is comparatively faster when compared to other reporting module.

sect1.title: 2 – Advantages of Excel report module
sect1.para: -Open and Easy to be customized for reports
-Fast to edit, modify and generate report
-Do not require large memory but allow large number of users generating report at same time without out of memory exception.

sect1.title: 3 – Requirement of Excel report module
sect1.para: -User’s computer has to be installed Microsoft Office or Open office. However, this may be solved by Preview function to view report via web.

sect1.title: 4 – Main features in Excel Report module

screenshot.screeninfo: Main features in Excel Report module

listitem.para: -Create report

oTo create many types of report, such as: report containing standard data elements, report listing organization unit groups as rows, report listing period of time as columns, report generating data elements combined with categories.

oThe report item types for designing reports, such as: data element, indicator, serial no (for generating sequence no in report), data element name, data element code, organization unit name, and organization unit group.
-Generate report
oAllow users to generate reports according to parameters: period of time, organization unit, organization unit group and to generate group of reports to many sheets of 1 Excel file.

-Import data from Excel file into Database of DHIS
oIn the need of saving and transmitting data between health workers or within the local organization units where internet is not available. User may need to enter data in excel file and import it into the database. This feature allows user to import data from a pre-designed excel template into DHIS database automatically or just import some data elements specified by users.

sect1.title: 5 – How to use Excel Reporting Module
sect1.para: To start using Excel Report Module, from the Main menu, chose Services, then click Excel Reports. See below:
Then a new page appears as following
At the Left menu, there are 2 main functions: Administration and Generate Report

listitem.para: Configurations: Set a path to the directory where the excel template files are stored.
List of reports: Allows users to create reports and its items and to assign the organization units or the organization unit groups to the reports.

Data Entry Status (or view the status of the data entry): View the data entry status to know about data entered, report finished or not finished yet with data entry. In order to view the data entry status, adding data sets which is equivalent to the data entry is mandatory.

Clean temporary directory: Every time a user generates a report, the system creates an excel file in the temporary directory (excelreporttemplate directory). This directory would be larger and larger after some time and occupy a lot of memory. This function will clean those files from temporary directory.
Generate Report function has sub functions
Generate Report: generates reports
Generate advanced report: Generates reports by Org Unit group.
Import excel files: imports data values from an Excel file to the DHIS’s database
Data Set completed reports: generates the report status of completeness of entering data .
Data entry Status: views data entry status.
Individual reports: generates user’s defined reports

sect1.para: User can generate reports using Excel Reporting module steps by steps as below

sect2.title: Create Excel Report template file and configure the path to folder where contains Excel report template file

sect3.title: Types of report
sect3.para: Before generating reports we need to have Excel template files and the reports will be generated in the standard forms following the templates. Currently, there are 4 report types that the module can support.

sect4.title: Standard reports contain default data elements and indicators
sect4.para: Standard reports have fix model in which number of the columns and the rows are unchangeable. And normally, this report is generated by only 1 organization unit or 1 organization unit group at a specified period of time.

sect4.title: Reports list the organization units in the rows
sect4.para: This type of report displays data elements’ name in the fixed columns, and organization units are be displayed automatically according to the selected parents organization unit in a period of time. These organization units are also grouped together following the administrative level, such as: province, district, commune, etc.

sect4.title: Reports list time periods in the columns
sect4.para: This report display data values according to the fixed data element names, and the list of time periods are displayed automatically.

sect4.title: Reports with data values are the combination between data elements and categories
sect4.para: This type of report displays data values which are combined of data elements and category combination. Data element names display as rows and category options are displayed as columns. Data elements’ names, codes may be displayed automatically as well as the sequence numbers of the rows.

sect3.title: Directory Configuration
sect3.para: Directory Configuration is to set the path of the directory containing the ExcelTemplate (.xls) file.
Steps to set the directory’s path: Administrator > Configuration> Set path to folder contains excel file

listitem.para: Click Administration to open Administrator page.
Click Configuration button
Set a path to the folder containing excel file
Excel template directory is a directory created in the system, recommended inside the folder of DHIS 2.
Click Ok to save

sect2.title: Create a new report in DHIS2 with Excel report template file
sect2.para: When the Excel report template file is available, creating a new report and the relevant report items are required. See below:

listitem.para: Create new report : Administration --> List Of Report --> Add --> Fill the information form --> Ok
Create report items in the report : Administration --> List Of Report --> Report Items --> Add --> Fill information form -->Ok

sect3.title: Create new report
sect3.para: Click List Of Reports
Add new report: Click Add button to add new report
Fill report information in this form

listitem.para: Name *: Enter Name of report
Excel Template*: Enter name of Excel report template file. (include extension)
Report Type *: Choose report type
Normal : to create reports include just data elements or indicator
Category : to create reports with data values are combined of data elements and categories
Period column listing: to create reports which list data values according to time period of specified organization unit.
Organization unit listing: reports which list data values according to organization units.
Period position row and Period position column: Row and Column Number in Excel template file where to put Period value.
Organization Unit Row and Organization Unit Column: Row and Column Number in Excel template file where to put Organization Unit Name.
Click Ok button to create new report

sect3.para: There are 4 operating buttons

listitem.para: Report Associations For assigning reports to organization units
Report Item For creating report items in the report
Remove For removing report
Edit for editing report’s information.
Organization unit Group : For choose which organization group would be list in the report. This button only appear when the Report Type is Organization Unit Listing
Data element groups : This button only available when report type is Category. This button for create Data element group and these groups of data elements would be list in the report.

sect3.title: Create report items
sect3.para: Click Create Report Item button
Click Add button to open a form
Fill the report item’s information

listitem.para: Name*: Enter report item name (Ex: Total person joined HIA)
Item Type*: Chose item types
Data element : if this report item is data element
Indicator: : if this report item is indicator
Excel formulary: if this item describes the excel formulary
Data element Name: if report item is list of data element’s names
Data element Code: If report item is list of data element’s codes
Serial : If report item is list of auto generating sequence no
Organization: if report item is list of organization unit.

Period Type*: Chose period type which data values of that report item would be aggregated and displays according to period parameter that user will choose when generate report. (Last 3 months, Last 6 months, So far this year, Quarterly, Six-Monthly, Yearly).
Expression *: Click Expression button to choose Data element, Indicator, Or just type excel formulary if Item type is Excel formulary.
The category option would be default if data element hasn’t been combined with any category combo
Sheet No*: type sheet no where this report item would be display in excel template file
Row*: row number refers to cell where report item would be display in Excel file.
Column*: column number refers to cell where report item would be display in Excel file.
Click Ok button to create report item.

sect3.para: New report item has been created

row.entry: There is at least 1 period type in a report.

sect3.para: Copy selected items to button: To copy the report items when the new report has an item which can be reused from the existing report.

listitem.para: List of report: chose a destination report
Sheet No: Choose the Sheet No which report Item would be display.

row.entry: -Copy selected items to other report for fast developing many reports with the same data elements but with the difference from period aggregated data values.

sect3.title: Assign report to Org Units
sect3.para: Click Report Associations button:
Chose Org Units to assign and click Save button

Select Org Unit groups which would be available in report: There is a difference between Select Org Units to assign to report for Orgunit generate reports later, which select org unit groups are list of orgunit groups would be availabe in reports.
This function only appears in Organization Unit Listing report type.
Click Organization Unit group button.
Select Organisation unit groups, arrange sequence of these groups and click Ok to save

sect3.title: Assign report to user role
sect3.para: To manage the authority of using the reports, we should assign reports to user roles.

listitem.para: From Main menu, choose Maintenance > Users
From Left menu, chose User Role
Click Edit button to edit User role’s information
Select Excel reports, click Save button to assign excel reports to user role.

sect3.title: Generate report
sect3.para: To generate a report we can follow these steps

listitem.para: Click Generate Report
Select Org Unit
Select report Group
Select Report from list
Select period
Select period
Click Generate Report button

sect3.title: Generate advanced report
sect3.para: This Generate Advanced Report function allow users to generate a report according to the parameters such as: Report group name, Report name, selected period, and organization unit group name. The difference between Generate Advanced Report function and Generate Report function is that the advanced one can generate report according to group of Org Units with the same level, for example

sect3.title: Generate an individual report
sect3.para: This function allows users to generate the reports with data elements and a list of period as their individual decision. Another way, user can generate a dirty report by selecting data elements, periods to generate a simple excel report without excel template file or creating report or report items. Then, user can bookmark this report for generating later. The steps to generate individual report are listed below

listitem.para: Click Individual report function from the left menu
Select organization unit
Select data elements
Select category option of selected data element
Click select button
Select period type
Select periods
Click select button
Click generate report button
Click Book mark button for generate later

sect3.title: View data set complete reports
sect3.para: When users finish entering data for a data set, they need to click COMPLETE button to identify that the data set is completely entered. View Data set complete report function takes care of this completeness. There are 2 ways of viewing data set complete reports. View as Period or Dataset. When viewing with Period, user can see the datasets according to many periods of time. Viewing with Data set, users can see many data sets in only a specified period.

sect3.title: View data entry status
sect3.para: View data entry status function allows users to see which datasets are entered with data and how the data values are entered. This helps save time for the health manager to follow the completeness of the data entered. In particular, there is a need of viewing data set entry status.

listitem.para: Add data set to view
Data Entry Status page would be displayed. Click Add button to add data set.
Select data set and org unit
View Data entry status
From Left menu, click Data Entry Status > Select Org Unit name to view.

sect2.title: Import data values from Excel file to DHIS
sect2.para: This feature allows users to import data from Excel file to DHIS’s database.
The steps to import data from Excel file to data base

listitem.para: Select Org Unit name
Select and upload excel file which contains data values
Select template excel file
Select period
Press Preview button, the system show data elements and correspondent data values, as follow picture
Check to select data elements to import
Press Import data button

sect2.para: Requirement for importing the data with Excel reporting module: Excel files which contains data values must have formatted in the same form with the items in the predefined Excel template file.
Example with an Excel file contains data values
This is Excel template file which is same format with above Excel file.

row.entry: Both Excel file with data values and Excel template file must be same at format

sect2.para: The EXCEL REPORTING module is continuing develop and the documentation of it for users will be updated. All feedback will be appreciated, please inform us at dhis2-documenters@lists.launchpad.net.
